lv.emes.libraries.communication.tcp_ip.client

Class MS_TcpIPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.communication.tcp_ip.MS_TcpIPAbstract
      • lv.emes.libraries.communication.tcp_ip.client.MS_TcpIPClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MS_TcpIPClient
extends MS_TcpIPAbstract
    TCP/IP client which operates commands to connect and communicate to server.

    Public methods: -registerNewCommand -getCommandList -addDataToContainer -cmdToServer -getId -connect -disconnect

    Public properties to set: -onServerGoingDown

    Protected methods: -onIncomingServerMessage -writeln

    Version:
    1.1.
    Author:
    eMeS

    • Field Detail

      • onServerGoingDown

        public IFuncOnServerGoingDown onServerGoingDown
        Set this property with lambda expression to do actions after server went down (disconnected).
        Note: communication with this server is already impossible at this moment.

        () -> {some action};

    • Constructor Detail

      • MS_TcpIPClient

        public MS_TcpIPClient()
        Creates object and initializes default commands.

    • Method Detail

      • registerNewCommand

        public void registerNewCommand(MS_ClientCommand cmd)
        Adds new command to command list. Commands are recognized by code. All commands must be unique. Commands cannot be deleted, except by clearing command list. If server sends particular command to client, server acts just as command's implementation asks.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command code and method which will be triggered when client sends particular command.

      • getCommandList

        public MS_List<MS_ClientCommand> getCommandList()
        That is recommended not to use this variable. Use only if it is really necessary to do manual changes in list of already registered commands.
        Returns:
        List of all registered commands.
        See Also:
        registerNewCommand(lv.emes.libraries.communication.tcp_ip.client.MS_ClientCommand)

      • getId

        public int getId()

      • getCommandByCode

        public MS_ClientCommand getCommandByCode(java.lang.String cmdCode)
        Tries to find command in registered command list.
        Parameters:
        cmdCode - code of command.
        Returns:
        MS_ClientCommand or null if command doesn't exist in registered command list.

      • addDataToContainer

        public void addDataToContainer(java.lang.String someData)
        Adds some data for next command.
        Overrides:
        addDataToContainer in class MS_TcpIPAbstract
        Parameters:
        someData - textual data content to be added to send together with next command.

      • cmdToServer

        public boolean cmdToServer(java.lang.String cmdCode)
        Use this method to send custom command to server! If some data added with addDataToContainer, those will also be sent by this message.

        Data is simply string list with index starting with 1, cause 0 is for cmdCode. Data container is cleared after this method in every case.

        Parameters:
        cmdCode - command ID.
        Returns:
        false if error occurred during sending message or connection is not established.
        See Also:
        addDataToContainer(java.lang.String)

      • getIsActive

        public boolean getIsActive()
        Synonym for isConnected.
        Specified by:
        getIsActive in class MS_TcpIPAbstract
        Returns:
        whether client is ready for message exchange or not.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host,
                    int port)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Establishes new TCP/IP connection to the server. Message listener goes to new thread and listens for messages.
        Parameters:
        host - hostname or IP address of server.
        port - port number in which server can accept connections.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the IP address of the host could not be determined.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket or streams.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port parameter is outside the specified range of valid port values, which is between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()

        public void run()

        public boolean isConnected()
